title: Tesla on two wheels? India's Ola Electric feels the strains of success

content.background: Ola Electric, led by Bhavish Aggarwal, aims to become the Tesla of India by rolling out millions of electric scooters. However, the company is facing challenges in its service network as the surge in sales has led to significant backlogs and long repair times. Ola Electric is aggressively expanding its service network to address these issues and meet the growing demand.
content.summary: Ola Electric, India's leading e-scooter maker, is experiencing strain in its service network due to high demand for repairs and inadequate workforce and spare parts supply. The company's service centres in metropolitan areas are struggling to keep up, resulting in repair waiting times of up to two weeks. Ola Electric is taking steps to address these service capacity issues by adding new centres and technicians. Despite the challenges, Ola Electric aims to dominate the Indian electric vehicle market and achieve its goal of making all new scooters and motorbikes electric by 2025.
